name: Atacama Desert
hint: Driest non-polar desert on Earth, in northern Chile with world-class observatories

name: Patagonian Desert
hint: Largest desert in South America, a cold wind-swept steppe in southern Argentina

name: Sechura Desert
hint: Coastal desert in northwestern Peru, one of the driest spots in South America

name: Monte Desert
hint: Arid scrubland in central-western Argentina between the Andes and the Pampas

name: Guajira Desert
hint: Arid peninsula in northern Colombia and Venezuela, home to the Wayuu indigenous people

name: Salar de Atacama
hint: Largest salt flat in Chile, surrounded by volcanoes and home to flamingo-filled lagoons

name: Nazca Desert
hint: Peruvian desert plateau famous for its mysterious ancient geoglyphs visible from the air

name: Tatacoa Desert
hint: Red and grey badlands in Colombia's Huila department, popular for stargazing

name: Siloli Desert
hint: High-altitude desert in Bolivia's altiplano known for the famous Stone Tree rock formation

name: Medanos de Coro
hint: National park of shifting sand dunes in Venezuela's Falcon state near the Caribbean
